alert.note: Alert for Dade; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 4:32AM CDT until May 05 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Dade and Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 AM CDT, Very heavy rainfall has caused widespread flooding of river creeks, roads, and low water crossings. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in the warning area since yesterday with locally higher amounts. - This includes the following low water crossings... Turnback Creek at County Road 2100, Sinking Creek at County Road 181, Spring River at County Road 2110, Lousy Branch at County Road 85 and Sons Creek at County Road 113. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Greenfield, Lockwood, Miller, Everton, Dadeville, Stotts City and Halltown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stream and creek flow is very high, much higher than typical flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
